title: Ending the Weaponization of the Federal Government

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Department of Justice and Intelligence Community leadership to review and report on any misuse of federal law enforcement and intelligence resources over the past four years, particularly political targeting or abuses. It establishes a policy of accountability to correct past misconduct and ensure such weaponization of government agencies does not continue.
potential_concerns: The review process could politicize the Department of Justice and Intelligence Community by focusing on one administration's actions while ignoring others.
Potential overreach or broad reinterpretation of what constitutes 'weaponization' could chill legitimate law enforcement and intelligence activities.
Document retention and compliance enforcement could lead to internal conflicts or litigation within agencies.
Lack of clear enforcement mechanisms or timelines may reduce the effectiveness of accountability measures.
Critics might see the order as undermining prosecutorial independence or interfering with ongoing criminal investigations.
